Posts.Content: On 1/16/2008 Sharpies1978 wrote: Hello,  I'm wondering if anyone can offer me some ideas on a gift for my mom. She will be having surgery (radical mastectomy) on Friday. I'd like to get her an extra special get-well gift. I was thinking of something that will help her through this time but I don't want it to be strictly about the cancer...I'm sure she thinks of it enough. Any ideas?  Steph Hi Steph,  Your just being with her is a gift in itself.  She's lucky to have you so close by.  When I was first diagnosed (lung cancer), I started a collection of angels.  I have big ones, little ones, ones that light up, magnet ones..... and every one is special.  My family and friends have given me many different ones over the last 15 months along with many of their prayers.  Maybe your Mom would like an angel "for her shoulder".  I wish you well and please keep us posted.  God Bless you both.
Posts.Title: Gift for my mom

Posts.Content: Arnold, Please accept my sincere condolences in the loss of your sister.  May you find comfort in knowing that she is now in a better place where there is no pain. God be with you.
Posts.Title: My Dearest Sister Passed away

Posts.Content: I am so sorry to hear the biopsy was positive.  But a word to the wise, the longer you can go through this without letting your employer know the better off you will probably be.  People change drastically when they are confronted with this type info.  Wait until you know you will be out of work for an extended period of time before you tell them.  Good luck and God Bless
